pli-tv-kd22:1.1.2: Most of these practices are obscure. They are explained further down in the text.
pli-tv-kd22:1.7.5: See the Critical Pali Dictionary, sub-point 3g, for this use of _kata_.
pli-tv-kd22:1.10.13: [Sp-ṭ.1.0](): _Siṅgena loṇaṁ pariharitvā pariharitvā aloṇakapiṇḍapātena saddhiṁ bhuñjituṁ kappati, na sannidhiṁ karotīti adhippāyo_, “Carrying salt in horn here and there, is it allowable to eat it together with unsalted almsfood? The meaning is one should not store it.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.3.34: [Sp-ṭ.3.4.454](): _Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāmāti kiñcāpi mayaṁ mahallakā, etaṁ pana theraṁ garuṁ katvā vasissāmāti adhippāyo_, “_Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāma_: although I am a senior monk, I will dwell respecting this senior monk.” | [Vmv.4.454]() adds: _Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāmāti nissayamuttāpi mayaṁ ekaṁ sambhāvanīyagaruṁ nissayabhūtaṁ gahetvāva vasissāmāti adhippāyo_, “_Garunissayaṁ gaṇhāma_: even though I no longer need support, I will live supported by one who is to be respected.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.4.4: [Vmv.4.455]() explains _mūlādāyakā_ as follows: _Mūlādāyakāti paṭhamaṁ dasavatthūnaṁ dāyakā_, “_Mūlādāyakā_ means those who first gave the ten practices.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.5.5: [Sp.4.455](): _Kullakavihārenāti uttānavihārena_, “_Kullakavihāra_ means a straightforward meditation.” This, however, seems like a put-down, which does not fit the context well. It seems more likely to me that _kullaka_ is instead related to Sanskrit _kulya_, “of a good/noble family”.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.20: Literally, “This is the first voting ticket that I place.”
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.23: Literally, “When two finger-breadths of shade have passed, is it allowable to eat at the wrong time.” I interpret this to mean within two finger-breadths of midday.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.50: _Uposathasaṁyutta_ is identified at [Sp-ṭ.3.4.457]() as the _Uposathakkhandhaka_, “The Chapter on the Observance Day”. But perhaps it is best regarded as a forerunner to the _Uposathakkhandhaka_.
pli-tv-kd22:2.8.109: [Sp.4.457](): _Chedanakasikkhāpade vuttapācittiyaṁ āpajjatīti attho_, “The meaning is he commits the said offense entailing confession in the training rule on cutting.”
